meanings.definition: To sprinkle or scatter with small particles or grains.
meanings.sent1: She was peppering the salad with cheese.
meanings.sent2: The chef was peppering the dish with herbs.
meanings.sent3: The kids were peppering the playground with sand.
meanings.sent4: The rain was peppering the roof like tiny drums.
meanings.sent5: The artist was peppering the canvas with colorful dots.

meanings.definition: To sprinkle or scatter with something.
meanings.sent1: He was peppering his conversation with jokes.
meanings.sent2: The speaker was peppering her speech with interesting facts.
meanings.sent3: The movie was peppering the scenes with unexpected twists.
meanings.sent4: The music was peppering the air with joyful notes.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was peppering the lesson with engaging activities.
